choices.B: Dead peer detection must be disabled to support this type of IPsec setup.
choices.C: The TunnelB route is the primary route for reaching the remote site. The TunnelA route is used only if the TunnelB VPN is down.
choices.D: This is a redundant IPsec setup.
choices.A: This setup requires at least two firewall policies with the action set to IPsec.

questions.question_text: Which one of the following processes is involved in updating IPS from FortiGuard?

choices.B: Protocol decoder update requests are sent to service.fortiguard.net.
choices.A: FortiGate IPS update requests are sent using UDP port 443.
choices.D: IPS engine updates can only be obtained using push updates.
choices.C: IPS signature update requests are sent to update.fortiguard.net.

discussion.content:
It could be B: A central SNAT policy is processed from top to bottom and if a match is found, src address and src port are translated based on the central SNAT policy
OR it could be D: SNAT policy is selected according to the configuration of the firewall policy that matches the traffic.
FOrtigate security 6.2 study guide page 165

comments.content: The question mentions Central SNAT, so there is no SNAT on a firewall policy level.

choices.A: It selects the SNAT policy specified in the configuration of the outgoing interface.
choices.D: It selects the SNAT policy specified in the configuration of the firewall policy that matches the traffic.
choices.C: It selects the central SNAT policy with the lowest priority.
choices.B: It selects the first matching central SNAT policy, reviewing from top to bottom.

questions.question_text: How does FortiGate select the central SNAT policy that is applied to a TCP session?

discussion.content:
A and C
B incorrect => IPSEC ACTION in a firewall policy is used with policy-based VPN and not route-based VPN

B- action can be set to Accept,Deny and learn so is wrong.A is correct :
Adding XAuth authentication
Extended Authentication (XAuth) increases security by requiring additional user authentication in a separate exchange at the end of the VPN Phase 1 negotiation. The FortiGate unit challenges the user for a user name and password. It then forwards the userâ€™s credentials to an external RADIUS or LDAP server for verification.

Implementation of XAuth requires configuration at both the FortiGate unit and the FortiClient application. For information about configuring a FortiGate unit as an XAuth server, see Phase 1 parameters. The following procedure explains how to configure the FortiClient application.
So the correct answers are A&C.

comments.content: for me correct are C and D
But Xauth is use for dialup vpn no site to site vpn

choices.D: If the VPN is configured as a policy-based in one peer, it must also be configured as policy-based in the other peer.
choices.A: If XAuth is enabled as a server in one peer, it must be enabled as a client in the other peer.
choices.B: If the VPN is configured as route-based, there must be at least one firewall policy with the action set to IPSec.
choices.C: If the VPN is configured as DialUp User in one peer, it must be configured as either Static IP Address or Dynamic DNS in the other peer.

questions.question_text: Which of the following conditions are required for establishing an IPSec VPN between two FortiGate devices? (Choose two.)
Which of the following statements about converse mode are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Correct answer : A & C

Typo in question:Conserve mode
Correct Answer is:A & C
A & C, Reverse Path Filter configuration will drop based on source Ip, conserve mode block AV
also for me is A & C

choices.A: FortiGate stops sending files to FortiSandbox for inspection.
choices.B: FortiGate stops doing RPF checks over incoming packets.
choices.D: Administrators can access the FortiGate only through the console port.
